Description.Text: The Galata Antique Hotel is a perfect hotel for location, price and service. Being an old mansion, it creates a warm atmosphere in itself. Recommended. (JMG 06/07)

Galata Antique Hotel Istanbul Taksim is in a perfect location for individual tourists. Very popular districts in Istanbul, such as Taksim Square, Sultanahmet, Eminonu, Besiktas and Nisantasi are just a few minutes away. Taksim is the perfect area for shopping, with nice bars and cafes. Galata Antique Hotel Istanbul is near the historic tunnel at the end of famous pedestrian Istiklal Street. Istiklal Street in Taksim is a must see for a trip to Istanbul. It has played an important role in history too. Since the 17th century Grand Rue de Pera (former name of Istiklal Street) has hosted several churches, historic monuments, antique shops, stores, cafes, bars and terrace restaurants.

With a total of 23 guest rooms, Galata Antique Hotel Istanbul, being an old 17th century house, provides an intimate atmosphere in the heart of this lively neighbourhood. Each room has been tastefully decorated and comfortably furnished to make the stay as relaxing as possible. All the rooms are equipped with the following facilities: private bathroom, central heating, hairdryer, direct dial telephone, satellite television and minibar.

Galata Antique Hotel Istanbul was originally built as a mansion in 1881 by the famous architect Alexandre Vallaury. Pera Palace, Istanbul Archeology Museum, Bosphorus Palace, Academy of Fine Arts and Markiz Passage are some examples of his legacy in Istanbul.
The hotel has the Antique Bar, in the lobby, which is an ideal place for relaxation and drinks and the Vallaury Restaurant which offers good international cuisine.
The lobby is small and decorated tastefully. Good atmosphere.
